analyzed: 'on te mya ngan las 'das pa la yang so sor rtog pa med do snyam na /

analyzed: ha cang khyad par yod pa nyid gsal bar byed pa ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gzhi ma yin pa'i phyir na /

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ma rig pa nyid ma yin no snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /

original: 'on te de ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te de ni zhes bya ba ste /

original: @228a * // mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: @228a * // mya ngan las 'das pa'o //

original: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //

original: da ni so sor rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: da ni so sor rtog pa med pa'o //

original: de'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ni nyon mongs pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ni nyon mongs pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: ji ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid ma rig pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa sel bas /üîΩrig pa'i ma mthun phyogs nyid phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid ma rig pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa sel bas / rig pa'i ma mthun phyogs nyid phyir //

analyzed: zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni rig pa dang 'gal ba'i zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: rig pa med pa bkag pa tsam gyi bdag nyid ni'o //

analyzed: de med pa ni zhes bya ba ni rig pa ldog pa'o //

analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba yang ni phung po lhag ma med pa la yang ngo //
translated: Nirvana is also the absence of the remaining aggregates.

original: 'on te nyon mongs pa'i gzhi nyid ni ma rig pa yin la /üîΩde yang mya ngan las 'das pa med do snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te nyon mongs pa'i gzhi nyid ni ma rig pa yin la / de yang mya ngan las 'das pa med do snyam na /
translated: But if the basis of the afflictions is ignorance,üîΩand that does not exist in nirvana,

original: med pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: med pa ni zhes gsungs so //

original: ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yang ha cang thal ba'i phyir ma rig par mi 'thad do zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yang ha cang thal ba'i phyir ma rig par mi 'thad do zhes bshad pa ni /

original: de las gzhan pa yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa yang zhes bya ba ste /

original: rig pa de las gzhan ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa de las gzhan ma rig pa'o //
translated: It is not ignorance, which is other than that knowledge.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams la yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams la yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that the five aggregates of form and so on are also ignorance.

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phung po lnga yod do zhes bya ba lung yin te /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phung po lnga yod do zhes bya ba lung yin te /
translated: The scriptural passage that states that in the nirvana that is not devoid of remainder there are five nonafflicted aggregates is as follows:

original: des na de dag kyang ma rig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de dag kyang ma rig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it follows, absurdly, that those are also ignorance.üîΩBecause it is untenable that it is the nature of both,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i rang bzhin ma rig par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i rang bzhin ma rig par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: thus,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dpe nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa'o //üîΩ'o na chos ma yin ci zhig snyam na /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dpe nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa'o // 'o na chos ma yin ci zhig snyam na /
translated: he establishes the example with the words ‚Äúit is just like.üîΩ‚Äù Well then, what is it that is not a phenomenon?

original: chos ma yin pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is that which is not a phenomenon.

original: gzhan dag gis bden pa dang mi bden ba'i tshig gnyis 'chol bar smras pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis bden pa dang mi bden ba'i tshig gnyis 'chol bar smras pa ni /
translated: Others say that the words of truth and falsehood are confused.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were so, then...

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa ston pa mi bden pa yin na'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa ston pa mi bden pa yin na'o //
translated: If it were not true, it would not be true.

original: mi bden pa nyid du mi 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bstan pa'i dngos po yod pa'i phyir yang dag par ston pa yin pas /
analyzed: mi bden pa nyid du mi 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bstan pa'i dngos po yod pa'i phyir yang dag par ston pa yin pas /
translated: It is not so, because the thing that is taught exists, it is taught correctly.

original: 'dod pa gzhan du gyur pas mi bden par 'dod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod pa gzhan du gyur pas mi bden par 'dod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since the desired object is transformed, it is not considered false. This is the meaning.

original: med kyang na ni 'khrul pas yod par sems pa na gang gi tshe yod do zhes ston pa de'i tshe yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don mi brjod pa'i phyir brdzun smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med kyang na ni 'khrul pas yod par sems pa na gang gi tshe yod do zhes ston pa de'i tshe yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don mi brjod pa'i phyir brdzun smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not exist, but is imagined to exist through error, when it is taught that it exists, then it is false speech, because it does not express a meaning that is true.

original: 'di yang sems pa zhes bya ba 'di'i de ma thag tu med do zhes ston par @228b byed pa zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: 'di yang sems pa zhes bya ba 'di'i de ma thag tu med do zhes ston par @228b byed pa zhes 'brel to //
translated: This is also connected with the statement immediately following this, ‚ÄúIt is not so, because it is taught that it does not exist.‚Äù

original: snga mas ni mi 'dod pa 'thob par bstan la phyi mas ni 'dod pa mi 'thob par ro //
analyzed: snga mas ni mi 'dod pa 'thob par bstan la phyi mas ni 'dod pa mi 'thob par ro //
translated: The former shows the attainment of what is not desired, and the latter shows the non-attainment of what is desired.

original: yang dag pa nyid dam yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid ni bsam pa la ltos pa yin gyi don la ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni sgra rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid dam yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid ni bsam pa la ltos pa yin gyi don la ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni sgra rnams zhes bya ba'o //

original: don dam par dngos po yod pa yin yang gal te med par nges pas med do zhes ston na de'i tshe ni tshig de bden pa kho na ste /
analyzed: don dam par dngos po yod pa yin yang gal te med par nges pas med do zhes ston na de'i tshe ni tshig de bden pa kho na ste /
translated: Even though an entity exists ultimately, if one teaches that it does not exist because it is ascertained as non-existent, then at that time those words are only true,

original: rnam par rtog pa yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yul yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni nges pa dang rjes su mthun par mi brjod na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni nges pa dang rjes su mthun par mi brjod na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means if one does not speak in accordance with certainty.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni don ci lta ba bzhin gyi bsam ba ji lta ba nyid brjod pa ni bden pa yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni don ci lta ba bzhin gyi bsam ba ji lta ba nyid brjod pa ni bden pa yin la /
translated: For the bodhisattvas, speaking in accordance with the intention that corresponds to the meaning is true,üîΩand speaking otherwise is false.

original: gzhan ni mi bden pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan ni mi bden pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: This is stated in the verse:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni //
translated: For the bodhisattvas,üîΩspeaking in accordance with the meaning is true,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and speaking otherwise is false.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba yin bas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba yin bas so //
translated: Therefore means because it is a misdeed.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni ji skad brjod pa las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni ji skad brjod pa las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Other means the opposite of what has been stated.

original: dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has an object means because it has the nature of an object.

original: 'di sems las byung ba nyid du ji ltar grub ce na /üîΩrten dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di sems las byung ba nyid du ji ltar grub ce na / rten dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: How is it established as a mental factor?üîΩBecause it is similar to the mind in terms of basis and so on.

original: rten la sogs pas mtshungs pa nyid du ldan pas na mtshungs bar ldan pa zhes chos mngon pa las 'di sems las byung ba'i nang du brjod do //
analyzed: rten la sogs pas mtshungs pa nyid du ldan pas na mtshungs bar ldan pa zhes chos mngon pa las 'di sems las byung ba'i nang du brjod do //
translated: Since it is similar to the mind in terms of basis and so on, it is called similar to the mind. In the Abhidharma it is stated as a mental factor.

original: de la gang ma rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ma rig pa yin na de'i tshe 'di dmigs pa dang rnam pa la sogs pa mtshungs par mi gsung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gang ma rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ma rig pa yin na de'i tshe 'di dmigs pa dang rnam pa la sogs pa mtshungs par mi gsung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If ignorance is the nature of noncomprehension, then it would not be stated as similar to the mind in terms of object, aspect and so on.

original: de la rten dang dmigs par mtshungs pa ni mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams dang rten dang dmigs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rten dang dmigs par mtshungs pa ni mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams dang rten dang dmigs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In this regard, it is similar to the mind in terms of basis and object because it is similar to the mind in terms of basis and object.

original: rnam pa mtshungs pa ni sems bzhin du rtogs pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa mtshungs pa ni sems bzhin du rtogs pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are similar in aspect because they have the aspect of realization like the mind.

original: dus mtshungs pa ni dus mnyam par byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa ni dus mnyam par byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are similar in time because they arise at the same time.

original: ji ltar sems skad cig gcig la rdzas gcig pa yin pa de bzhin du sems las byung ba yang rdzas re re'i bdag nyid can yin pa des na rdzas mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar sems skad cig gcig la rdzas gcig pa yin pa de bzhin du sems las byung ba yang rdzas re re'i bdag nyid can yin pa des na rdzas mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: Just as the mind is a single substance in a single moment, so too mental factors are the nature of a single substance. Therefore, they are similar in substance.

original: des na sems las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na sems las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, because they are mental factors, ignorance is not by nature realization.

original: 'on kyang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin kho na'o //üîΩrigs pas bsgrubs nas dngos su rjod par byed pa'i lung yang brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin kho na'o // rigs pas bsgrubs nas dngos su rjod par byed pa'i lung yang brjod pa ni /

original: gsungs ba'i yang phyir te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsungs ba'i yang phyir te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The scriptures that explicitly state this through reasoning are stated in the line ‚Äúbecause it is said.üîΩ‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi rnam pa @229a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi rnam pa @229a * //
translated: The aspect of wisdom

original: las zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'grol ba'o //
analyzed: las zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'grol ba'o //
translated: is liberated from that.

original: gzhung gang gis gsungs she na /
analyzed: gzhung gang gis gsungs she na /
translated: By what scripture is this stated?

original: de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'o //

original: gsungs pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other statement is ‚Äúin the same way.‚Äù

original: lung las ma rig pa gzhan kho nar bstan pa yin no snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: lung las ma rig pa gzhan kho nar bstan pa yin no snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The following is stated in response to the doubt that ignorance is taught as something else in the scriptures.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú If it is said‚Äù refers to the statement ‚Äúthe view of the transitory collection is ignorance.‚Äù

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú That also‚Äù refers to the view of the transitory collection.

original: ma rig pa yan lag tu zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la ma rig pa yan lag tu ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa yan lag tu zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la ma rig pa yan lag tu ste /
translated: ‚Äú Ignorance is a link‚Äù means that ignorance is a link in dependent origination.

original: der rang gi ngo bos brjod par bya ba las nye bar btags pa la dgos ba ci yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der rang gi ngo bos brjod par bya ba las nye bar btags pa la dgos ba ci yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúWhat is the purpose of positing it as a separate link?‚Äù is that it is not expressed in terms of its own nature but is imputed.

original: de ltar ma rig pa bstan pas ni tshad ma 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni de ltar ma rig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma rig pa bstan pas ni tshad ma 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni de ltar ma rig ces bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIn that case, there is no valid knowledge at all‚Äù is made in response to the teaching that ignorance is a separate link.

original: bzlog pa la ni zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'di la ni so sor ma brtags pa'i nyes pa tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa la ni zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'di la ni so sor ma brtags pa'i nyes pa tshad ma yin no //
translated: ‚Äú In the opposite case‚Äù means that in the statement ‚Äúignorance is the view of the transitory collection,‚Äù the fault of not analyzing the individual meanings of the words is a valid cognition.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag nyid 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag nyid 'chad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of these verses is as follows.

original: lta ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From the point of view of the view means from the point of view of the view of the transitory.

original: 'dis ni gzhan ni rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan ni rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba bshad do //
translated: This explains the phrase it is not reasonable for it to be anything else.

original: rnam 'grel la 'jug par byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam 'grel la 'jug par byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase if it were introduces the commentary on the verse that begins Even if it were something else.

original: gzhan du yin yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log tu dmigs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan du yin yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log tu dmigs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The phrase even if it were something else refers to the nature of the apprehension of the self in a distorted manner.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gti mug go //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gti mug go //
translated: The phrase that refers to delusion.

original: khyad par gyi sgra zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i sgra'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi sgra zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i sgra'o //
translated: The phrase the word 'distinction' refers to the word 'view of the perishable collection'.

original: spyi ni ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: spyi ni ma rig pa ste /
translated: The word general refers to ignorance.

original: de'i don can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the meaning of that word.

original: lta ba ma rig pa dang tha mi dad na tha dad pa la rten pa mtshungs par ldan par brjod par mi 'gyur ro zhes rtsod pa gnyis pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'dis 'gal bar byed pas 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: lta ba ma rig pa dang tha mi dad na tha dad pa la rten pa mtshungs par ldan par brjod par mi 'gyur ro zhes rtsod pa gnyis pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o // 'dis 'gal bar byed pas 'gal ba ste /
translated: If the view were not different from ignorance, then it would not be said that they are associated in the sense that they are different and have a common support. The phrase in the same way introduces the second objection.üîΩIt is a contradiction because it contradicts.

original: 'gal bar byed pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'gal bar byed pa'i tshig go //
translated: It is a contradictory statement.

original: bshad bya zhes bya ba ni spyi dang khyad par du rtogs pas so //
analyzed: bshad bya zhes bya ba ni spyi dang khyad par du rtogs pas so //
translated: The subject matter is the general and the specific, because of the understanding of the general and the specific.

original: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni spyi yin la /
analyzed: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni spyi yin la /
translated: Ignorance is the general term.

original: lta ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: lta ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
translated: View is the specific term.

original: gcig la yang nye bar bstan pa can gyi dngos pos tha dad par brtags pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gcig la yang nye bar bstan pa can gyi dngos pos tha dad par brtags pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The other says, It is imagined to be different by the thing that is taught in one place.

original: de'i bdag dang yang mtshungs par ldan bar 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba yang gzhan kha cig gi'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag dang yang mtshungs par ldan bar 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba yang gzhan kha cig gi'o //
translated: The other says, It is only concomitant with the self.

original: gal te 'gal ba'i phyir bdag med pa mthong bas bdag tu lta ba dang 'bral @229b mod /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba'i phyir bdag med pa mthong bas bdag tu lta ba dang 'bral @229b mod /
translated: If, because of the contradiction, the view of self is eliminated by the vision of selflessness,

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral bar go ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /üîΩstong nyid lta dang de 'gal phyir //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral bar go ji ltar 'gyur zhe na / stong nyid lta dang de 'gal phyir //
translated: how is it understood that one is freed from all the defilements?

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because of the contradiction with the view of emptiness.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba de 'gal ba'i phyir de las byung ba bdag tu lta ba'i rgyu can kun 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba de 'gal ba'i phyir de las byung ba bdag tu lta ba'i rgyu can kun 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Because of the contradiction with the view of the transitory aggregates, all that arises from it, having the view of self as its cause, is contradicted.

original: des na nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is the meaning that all afflictions are abandoned.

original: don la nye bar sbyor ba de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: bdag nyid chags pa dang ma bral ba las bdag la chags pa dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: bdag dor ba nyid du mi nus so zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de ni chags pa dang bral ba la yang mtshungs so zhes lan brjod pa ni /

original: bdag la bdag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag la bdag ces bya ba'o //

original: cis zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dri ba'o //
analyzed: cis zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dri ba'o //

original: 'o na te chags pa nyid chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'o na te chags pa nyid chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur na /

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de ni gzhan du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de ni gzhan du zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: chags pa de ni gzhan du 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //

original: gzhan te 'dod chags dang bral ba yang de ltar chags ba'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa min no //
analyzed: gzhan te 'dod chags dang bral ba yang de ltar chags ba'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa min no //
translated: And that which is detached from another would not remain with the nature of attachment.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar ma yin snyam na /üîΩbdag nyid kun nam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar ma yin snyam na / bdag nyid kun nam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is that not so?

original: bdag nyid kun gyis rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur na /
analyzed: bdag nyid kun gyis rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the self were to change in any way‚Äù means:

original: rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba nyid kyis 'thad par dka'o //
analyzed: rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba nyid kyis 'thad par dka'o //
translated: If the self were to change in any way, it would be difficult to maintain that it is not in contradiction with your own tenets.

original: phyogs gcig gis gzhan du 'gyur na 'thad par dka' ba nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gcig la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis gzhan du 'gyur na 'thad par dka' ba nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gcig la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were to change in part‚Äù means: it would be difficult to maintain that it is not in contradiction with your own tenets.

original: bdag gcig la ni phyogs gcig med do //
analyzed: bdag gcig la ni phyogs gcig med do //
translated: There is no part of the self.

original: gang gi phyir phyogs gcig yod na bdag de tha mi dad pa nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyogs gcig yod na bdag de tha mi dad pa nyid med par 'gyur ro //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩbshad pa gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩbshad pa gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Why is that?üîΩ‚ÄúBecause it is not tenable that the self is one and has parts‚Äù means:

original: des na phyogs gcig gzhan du gyur kyang bdag ni gzhan du gyur pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na phyogs gcig gzhan du gyur kyang bdag ni gzhan du gyur pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: 'on te yang phyogs gcig gzhan du gyur pas bdag gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du 'dod na /
translated: But if you maintain that the self is transformed because one part is transformed,

original: de la yang brjod pa ni de ltar yin na zhes bya ba ste /üîΩyang phyogs gcig gis gzhan du 'gyur ba yin na thug pa med par 'gyur te @241b phyogs gcig po de las gzhan yin la /
analyzed: de la yang brjod pa ni de ltar yin na zhes bya ba ste / yang phyogs gcig gis gzhan du 'gyur ba yin na thug pa med par 'gyur te @241b phyogs gcig po de las gzhan yin la /

original: de las gzhan yang de las gzhan yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan yang de las gzhan yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul du'o //
translated: If the self were transformed by the transformation of one part, then there would be an infinite regress, because that part would be different from that part, and that which is different from that would be different from that, and so on.

original: de nas bdag gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nas bdag gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no //

original: gang ma phyogs gcig po gzhan du gyur pa de yang bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ma phyogs gcig po gzhan du gyur pa de yang bdag ma yin no //

original: tha dad par med pa'i phyogs dogs par byas nas 'gog pa ni phyogs gcig pa gzhan min par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad par med pa'i phyogs dogs par byas nas 'gog pa ni phyogs gcig pa gzhan min par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Having assumed the position that they are not different, you refute it, saying, ‚ÄúThe part would not be different from the self.‚Äù

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin na yang ngo //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin na yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if that were so‚Äù means even if it were not different.

original: ci ltar thug pa med ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar thug pa med ce na /
translated: How is there an infinite regress?

original: der yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù means in that case.

original: gzhan ma yin pa gang yin pa da ni bdag bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa gang yin pa da ni bdag bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin la /
translated: What is not different is not like the self.

original: gang zhig gzhan du 'gyur ba de ni gzhan yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan du 'gyur ba de ni gzhan yin no //

original: de yang rnam pa 'gas gzhan ma yin na /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa 'gas gzhan ma yin na /

original: yang de nyid bzlas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang de nyid bzlas par bya ba'o //

original: des na thug pa med do //
analyzed: des na thug pa med do //

original: gang gi phyir de ltar chags pa dang ma bral bar gyur pa las chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar chags pa dang ma bral bar gyur pa las chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that one who is not free from attachment becomes free from attachment.

original: des ni thar par 'dod bas so //
analyzed: des ni thar par 'dod bas so //
translated: Therefore, one who desires liberationüîΩshould meditate on freedom from attachment.

original: de lta na yang 'dod chags dang bral ba bsgoms pa don med do zhes brjod pa ni de ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'dod chags dang bral ba bsgoms pa don med do zhes brjod pa ni de ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even so, it is meaningless to meditate on freedom from attachment when one is already free from attachment.

original: bdag dor ba nyid kyis bdag gi ba la chags pa dang bral ba grub pa'i phyir de la chags pa dang bral ba bsgoms pa ni don med do //
analyzed: bdag dor ba nyid kyis bdag gi ba la chags pa dang bral ba grub pa'i phyir de la chags pa dang bral ba bsgoms pa ni don med do //
translated: Since one who has abandoned the self is established as free from attachment to what belongs to the self, it is meaningless to meditate on freedom from attachment to that.

analyzed: 'on te yang rnam ba gang gis kyang bdag yongs su mi 'dor ba des na chags pa dang bral ba bsgom pa don dang bcas pa yin no snyam na /

original: rnam pa gang gis don med pa //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis don med pa //

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //

original: don med ces bya ba ni mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: don med ces bya ba ni mi nus pa'o //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: sdug bsngal zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes gsungs so //

original: rnam pa gzhan du sbyar ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du sbyar ba zhes pa ni /

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /

original: bya rog ces bya ba ste /

analyzed: log shes ni zhen pa'i snying po can bdag la sogs par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: A wrong consciousness is one that apprehends a core of attachment, such as the apprehension of a self.

original: de las byung ba'i zhen pa ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i zhen pa ni sred pa'o //
translated: Attachment that arises from that is craving.

original: de nyid sems pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid sems pa yin te /

original: de'i dbang ngam de'i mthus so //
analyzed: de'i dbang ngam de'i mthus so //

analyzed: ma la sogs par phyin pa'i rang bzhin dman pa'i gnas su 'gro ba ni skye ba yin no //

original: 'gal ba bdag med par lta ba des rgyu log pa'i shes pa de bcad par gyur na ni skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba bdag med par lta ba des rgyu log pa'i shes pa de bcad par gyur na ni skye bar mi 'gyur ro //

original: dbang bskur la goms pa'i cho ga ni de dang 'gal ba ma yin na snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur la goms pa'i cho ga ni de dang 'gal ba ma yin na snyam du dgongs pa'o //

original: gal te dbang bskur ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'i 'byung ba chen po skye ba'i rgyu ni dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i cho gas zlog par byed pa yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gal te dbang bskur ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'i 'byung ba chen po skye ba'i rgyu ni dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i cho gas zlog par byed pa yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas bshad pa ni /
translated: If you suspect that the cause of the birth of the great elements, which is not accompanied by consecration, etc. is averted by the rite of consecration, etc. , then the reply is:

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is thus.

original: de dag nyid ni log pa'i shes pa dang / sred pa sems pa dag nyid de /
analyzed: de dag nyid ni log pa'i shes pa dang / sred pa sems pa dag nyid de /
translated: Those very false views and the craving and intention are the cause of birth.

original: skye ba la nus pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la nus pa yin no //
translated: They are the power of birth.

original: 'di ltar bdag tu mngon par zhen nas chags pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag tu mngon par zhen nas chags pa'am /
translated: Thus, having conceived the self, one becomes attached to it.

original: sdang ba la rtsom par byed la /
analyzed: sdang ba la rtsom par byed la /
translated: and it is the cause of the beginning of hatred.

original: dman pa'i yul du ma phyin par byed kyi /
analyzed: dman pa'i yul du ma phyin par byed kyi /
translated: It is the cause of not arriving at the object of the inferior,

original: dbang bskur ba la sogs pa las bzlog pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba la sogs pa las bzlog pas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the cause of the opposite of the consecration, etc.

original: dbang bskur ba dang ni log pa'i shes pa yang 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba dang ni log pa'i shes pa yang 'gal ba ma yin no //

original: 'on te sems pa de dag nyid ni skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'on te sems pa de dag nyid ni skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes mi rigs te /
translated: But it is not correct to say that those intentions alone are the cause of birth,

original: las kyang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because karma also is a cause.

original: las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes //üîΩzhes bya ba yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes // zhes bya ba yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas /

original: sems pa de dag nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: sems pa de dag nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: Anticipating this doubt, he says, ‚Äúthose intentions alone.‚Äù

original: nyams pa med pa ni ma tshang ba med pa'o /
analyzed: nyams pa med pa ni ma tshang ba med pa'o /
translated: ‚ÄúWithout loss‚Äù means without deficiency.

original: ma rig pa dang sred pa dang las 'di gsum ni /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang sred pa dang las 'di gsum ni /
translated: Ignorance, craving, and karma

original: gnyis tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdbang po'i gnas su phyin pa la srid pa'i nus pa ston ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis tsam yin pa'i phyir ro // dbang po'i gnas su phyin pa la srid pa'i nus pa ston ba ni /
translated: are the two alone.üîΩThe demonstration of the power of existence in the object, etc.,

original: yul la sogs par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul la sogs par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is the demonstration of the power of existence in the object, etc.,üîΩof one who has arrived at the abode of the sense organ.

original: gal te skye ba sngar byas pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa yang las nyid ma yin nam snyam pa'i dogs pa zhe la bzhag nas /
analyzed: gal te skye ba sngar byas pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa yang las nyid ma yin nam snyam pa'i dogs pa zhe la bzhag nas /
translated: then one should keep in mind the following.

original: de yang bdag gi 'du byed pa 'di gnyis kho na'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang bdag gi 'du byed pa 'di gnyis kho na'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: These two formative forces are the cause of just this birth,

original: dngos su skye ba'i rgyu ma @249b yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dngos su skye ba'i rgyu ma @249b yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: but they are not the direct cause of birth.

original: skye ba gzhan 'byung byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir skye ba gzhan 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan 'byung byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir skye ba gzhan 'byung ba'o //
translated: Birth arises from another birth because it has the nature of producing another birth.

original: 'dis su byed pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'dis su byed pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since this is what is done by karma,

original: las ni dngos su zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: las ni dngos su zhes bya ba'o //

original: 'o na snga ma ji ltar las yin snyam na /üîΩsnga ma dag ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'o na snga ma ji ltar las yin snyam na / snga ma dag ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: If one thinks that the previous generosity and so forth are karma,üîΩthen the root text states, ‚ÄúThe previous ones are the cause of the birth of the next.‚Äù

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The previous ones are generosity and so forth.

original: 'o na rnam pa de lta bu'i skye ba'i rgyu dbang bskur bas /
analyzed: 'o na rnam pa de lta bu'i skye ba'i rgyu dbang bskur bas /

analyzed: 'di gnyis nyid bcom pa'i phyir na skye ba mi 'byung ngo snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: then since these two are destroyed, birth will not occur.üîΩIn response to this qualm, the root text states, ‚ÄúIf you say that the empowerment is the cause of birth,‚Äù and so on.

original: ci ste yang zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa la don 'di yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa la don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: log pa'i shes pa dang sred pa sems pa'i dbang gis 'gro bzhes bya ba ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa dang sred pa sems pa'i dbang gis 'gro bzhes bya ba ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is illogical to say that reincarnating beings are controlled by wrong consciousness and craving intention,

original: 'gro ba ni 'gro bar bya ba rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir dang / rtogs pa yang mig la sogs pa byed pa'i tshogs med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: yang na 'gro bar bya ba 'gro ba'i rten ni byed pa las kyi dbang po yin la /
analyzed: yang na 'gro bar bya ba 'gro ba'i rten ni byed pa las kyi dbang po yin la /
